item.title: Presidential debate: Trump refuses to take part in virtual TV event
item.description: The president says a commission's demand for it to be held remotely is to "protect" Joe Biden.

item.title: Nagorno-Karabakh: Armenia accuses Azerbaijan of shelling Shusha cathedral
item.description: Damage to the historic cathedral comes as international monitors try to end the escalating violence.

item.title: The young girl who swims with her pet python
item.description: Eight-year-old Inbar and her 3m pet python enjoy a swim in the pool.

item.title: French Open 2020: Sofia Kenin to play teenager Iga Swiatek in final
item.description: Australian Open winner Sofia Kenin and Polish teenager Iga Swiatek will play in Saturday's French Open women's final after two dominant semi-final displays.

item.title: FBI busts militia 'plot' to abduct Michigan Gov Gretchen Whitmer
item.description: Michigan Governor Gretchen Whitmer has become a target of coronavirus lockdown sceptics.

item.title: Louise Glück wins Nobel Prize for Literature
item.description: The US poet is recognised for the "austere beauty" of her work, says the Swedish Academy

item.title: German ex-chancellor Schröder under fire for Putin link
item.description: Ex-leader Gerhard Schröder refused to blame the Russian state over the poisoning of Alexei Navalny.

item.title: Belgian anaesthetist accused of causing Brit's death while drunk
item.description: Helga Wauters is accused of causing the death of Xynthia Hawke while performing a Caesarian section.

item.title: Prince William and Attenborough launch prize to save planet
item.description: The Duke of Cambridge and Sir David launch the biggest environmental award ever.

item.title: Spain abortion: Government works to repeal parental consent rule
item.description: The government says 16 and 17-year-olds should be able to seek an abortion without parental consent.

item.title: Covid-19: New restrictions to be announced for parts of England 'within days' - Jenrick
item.description: Minister Robert Jenrick did not rule out closing pubs and restaurants in the worst-affected areas.

item.title: Mexico's ex-security chief pleads not guilty to cartel links
item.description: As minister of public security, Genaro García Luna was Mexico's security chief from 2006 to 2012.

item.title: Are wildfires the end of the Californian dream?
item.description: As unprecedented wildfires rage across the Golden State, Californians have been bearing the brunt.

item.title: Final flight for British Airways' last two Heathrow-based Boeing 747 planes
item.description: British Airways' last two Heathrow-based Boeing 747 planes have departed from the airport on their final flight.

item.title: Giant hogweed: One man's battle against 'toxic invader'
item.description: Oskars has spent eight years trying to stop an invasive toxic weed surrounding his home in Latvia.

item.title: Artist Duncan Grant erotic drawings worth £2m kept under bed
item.description: A massive haul of drawings by Bloomsbury Group artist Duncan Grant is finally made public.

item.title: Matt Wilkinson: Former pro-surfer survives close call with shark
item.description: Australian surfer Matt Wilkinson was alerted to the shark by lifeguards using a drone.

item.title: Kenya's Maasai Olngesher ceremony: Young men graduate into community elders
item.description: Every 15 years, the Maasai hold the Olngesher ceremony where young men graduate to become community elders.

item.title: How Eddie Van Halen 'scared the hell out of a million guitarists'
item.description: How Eddie Van Halen changed the sound of rock music forever, one riff at a time.

item.title: Four Covid rules broken by Trump and the White House
item.description: How did so many of President Trump's top team become infected with coronavirus?

item.title: Sarah Forbes Bonetta: Portrait of Queen Victoria's goddaughter on show
item.description: English Heritage said it would feature portraits of "overlooked" black figures connected with its sites.

item.title: Toothless dinosaur with just two fingers discovered
item.description: Several complete skeletons of the unusual two-fingered dinosaurs were unearthed in the Gobi Desert.

item.title: Being black at Cambridge University
item.description: The BBC has followed three black students during their first year at the UK’s University of Cambridge.

item.title: Fighting Covid-19 in Afghanistan over the phone
item.description: The charity Teleheal helps fight coronavirus in Afghanistan by providing critical medical advice over the phone.

item.title: Hathras case: A fatal assault, a cremation and no goodbye
item.description: The family of an Indian woman who died after an alleged gang rape by upper-caste men are in torment.

item.title: VP debate: Did gender play a role in the interruptions?
item.description: Mike Pence interrupted Kamala Harris at least 10 times. Did gender play a role in this?

item.title: Kyrgyzstan election: Euphoria turns to insecurity as mob rule spreads
item.description: A power vacuum resulting from the seizure of parliament threatens to further destabilise the country.

item.title: The friends who drove a bus behind the Iron Curtain
item.description: The men and women who drove across Europe in a double-decker bus that was older than them.

item.title: Coronavirus in Africa: Five reasons why Covid-19 has been less deadly than elsewhere
item.description: The continent of a billion people has had fewer deaths than the UK despite the generally fragile health systems.

item.title: Four years and counting: The epic China-US takeover
item.description: The deadline for a Chinese firm's buyout of an American rival has already been extended 16 times.

item.title: September was world's 'hottest on record'
item.description: Scientists say it is a clear indication of temperatures rising because of emissions from our society.

item.title: Euro 2020 futures & bragging rights - a key day for the Home Nations
item.description: Northern Ireland, Scotland and the Republic of Ireland all fight for Euro 2020 qualification, while England face Wales in a friendly.

item.title: Hamilton against new Rio circuit being built in Camboata Forest
item.description: Lewis Hamilton opposes plans to hold the Brazilian Grand Prix at a new track in Rio De Janeiro to be built on land that is currently forest.

item.title: Demare wins stage six of Giro d'Italia in sprint finish
item.description: Arnaud Demare wins stage six of the Giro d'Italia in a sprint finish for his second victory of the 2020 race.

item.title: Mercedes team member tests positive for Covid
item.description: A member of the Mercedes team tests positive for coronavirus before this weekend’s Eifel Grand Prix.

item.title: Ozil left out of Arsenal's Europa League squad
item.description: Midfielder Mesut Ozil is omitted from Arsenal's Europa League squad for the forthcoming campaign.

item.title: Vice-presidential debate: Pence and Harris claims fact-checked
item.description: Face-off between Mike Pence and Kamala Harris covered coronavirus, the economy and the environment.

item.title: VP debate: Voters pleased with candidates' civility
item.description: The BBC watched the stand-off between Harris and Pence with four US voters. What did they make of it?

item.title: VP debate 2020: Harris and Pence debate on controversial Rose Garden event
item.description: Kamala Harris said the Trump administration did not tell the truth about the event on the White House lawn.

item.title: US election 2020: Fly steals the show at vice-presidential debate
item.description: The most talked about guest to take to the stage was a highly unlikely candidate.

item.title: US election 2020: Harris v Pence debate in pictures
item.description: Democrat Kamala Harris debated Republican Vice-President Mike Pence in Salt Lake City, Utah.

item.title: VP debate 2020: Harris and Pence dodge questions
item.description: The two candidates were asked about Supreme Court appointments and abortions, but neither directly answered the questions.

item.title: VP debate 2020: Kamala Harris attacks Trump administration over Covid-19 healthcare
item.description: Kamala Harris attacked the Trump administration's handling of healthcare for those with pre-existing conditions.

item.title: Kamala Harris: Where does she stand on key issues?
item.description: She's made history as the first black and Asian woman on a major US party ticket. What are her views?

item.title: Mike Pence: The rare times he made headlines
item.description: The vice-president has largely stayed out of the limelight. We take a look at the few times he didn't.

item.title: US election 2020: Your most pressing questions answered
item.description: From contested elections to to the electoral college, we answer the burning questions you sent us.
